page.title: 06MOUNTON FARM, TEMPLETON.
page.content: Mr Phillips gets up at 6.30am. He feeds the calves and checks the live stock. He milks at 6:45am.In the spring he sows fertilizer,spreads manure and harrows the fields. In summer he makes silage and hay and sprays the crops. In autumn he harvests the barley and drills the winter corn.In winter he ploughs the fields, maintains and cuts the hedges and feeds the cattle twice a day. The milk tanker collects the milk at 2.30pm. He milks the cows again at 4.30pm.His working day ends at 6.30pm in the winter and 10.00pm in the summer.He owns 70 cows, 60 beef and other cattle.He makes 3500 bales of hay and 600 tons of silage a year. The price of cattle is about 96p per kilo or about Â£600 per animal.He uses a combine and forage harvester,corn drill,hedge topper and baler.
